title: Is it wrong that me, a 12 year old is writing a romance novel? - Quora

response.answer_text: There’s absolutely nothing wrong with a 12 year old writing a romance novel, though I imagine you won’t want to do an “adult” one since you’re probably not overly familiar with that sort of material. The one thing any writer wants to do is to write about what they know or are capable of studying and/or understanding, and somehow I have a feeling your parents don’t really want you to know/study/understand that sort of content just yet. So yeah, probably stick to sweet and clean for now just to avoid catching that sort of flack. You’re better off to understand the emotional aspect before that other stuff anyway.

It’s not wrong, dear. You can write what you want—lots of people your age try to write romance. It’s a way of examining the concept of romance and looking at feelings that you are still too young to act upon. But remember that you personally know very little about romance yet. I suggest you talk to some adults, and ask them how they found love, if they are willing to talk about it—how they met, what attracted them to each other, and so on. Don’t ask for details about their physical reactions. Those are none of your business. Another way to explore romance is to write fanfiction about your favorite couples in the books or shows or movies you are into. Romance is hard even for some adults to write, so don’t worry much about that.
